stories.text: Are there resources or books to learn C/C++ with some story or analogies as we can find in Eloquent JavaScript, which go in sufficient details about the adjacent technologies? (hardware, memory, compilers, etc.)
stories.title: Ask HN: Equivalent of Eloquent JavaScript for C
Zero-Shot Text-Guided Object Generation with Dream Fields
The Cocktail Napkin Hall of Fame (2015)
The last two years in Miri
How neurons work is being elucidated
How to quit without burning bridges?

stories.text:
There are several paths/projects I'm interested in pursuing or are already pursuing that seem kinda niche, but a big part of me also really wants these things to be relevant to others, instead of just being a "me-thing".

What's your experience in navigating this tension between personal interest and relevance?

The advice I've seen so far have been pretty simplistic and I'm wondering if anyone has more substantial takes on it?

For example, how do you "soldier on" if/when feedback is bleak, or if you're met with blank faces? How do you maintain integrity without becoming completely irrelevant?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to balance one's personal interest while wanting to be relevant?
Moving Beyond Mimicry in Artificial Intelligence
